channel.title: IDk what else to do about this
channel.description: I've tried everything to get this port to open and just fail everytime. My modem is a CenturyLink 660 series My router is a Netgear WNDR3400 I really need help with this..

item.title: IDk what else to do about this
item.dc:creator: @awire20 awire20
item.description:
@awire20 wrote:

I’ve heard Utorrent is… reliable? I’ve done all this before. You’re right its not hard. But I have no clue why its not working.

Read full topic

item.title: IDk what else to do about this
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

awire20:

I’ve tried almost everything… I have made my ip static. Then I was told not to. There really is no reason for it to not be open. I just dont understand! I have teamview if you want to take a look for me? Other than that im out of ideas…

portforwarding is so simple… why do so many people have trouble with this, Just use utorrent…-___-

Read full topic

item.title: IDk what else to do about this
item.dc:creator: @Four2c0dez Four2c0dez
item.description:
@Four2c0dez wrote:

when you do ipconfig- Change where in the 3rd picture it says like 192.blah.blah.blah[open space] in the open space write the last 3 digits of the ipv4 address. try that if that doesnt work just change it back

Read full topic
item.source: IDk what else to do about this

item.title: IDk what else to do about this
item.dc:creator: @Doobage Doobage
item.description:
@Doobage wrote:

you should be connecting to your router via web browser with the routers ip, then logging in with a username and password to port forward to your host ip.

I dont have your router to give you an example but i suggest going to portforward.com and finding out how to access your router via web browser.

Worst case scenario, i’d contact your ISP and see if they can walk you through it, or do it for you one of the two, if they ask why do you need this port open, saying you play game online and i cant host games unless I have that port added.

Im sure they will help you.

Oh sorry i didnt see that 2nd picture,

Are you adding the right ip address to YOUR computer?

//

Also, try looking for a DMZ host and setting it to your ip address on your computer,

if that dont work, if you got a static nat option, try that. thats what I had to do.

Read full topic
